required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Characteristics and Outcome of Patients With COVID-19 in ICUs in South Tyrol
clinical_study.official_title: Characteristics and Outcome of Patients With COVID-19 Associated Respiratory Failure Treated in South Tyrol, Italy

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators retrospectively investigate the epidemiology, clinical characteristics and therapeutic interventions of patients with COVID-19 associated respiratory failure admitted to the intensive care units in South Tyrol, Italy.

detailed_description.textblock: In this observational, retrospective study the epidemiology, characteristics, therapeutic interventions and outcome of patients with COVID-19 associated respiratory failure admitted to the intensive care units in South Tyrol, Italy, are assessed. Data extracted from the medical patients' records include type and duration of respiratory support (high-flow nasal oxygen, non-invasive ventilation, invasive ventilation), need for tracheostomy, vasopressor needs, antibiotic therapy, corticosteroid treatment, laboratory values (interleukin-6, C-reactive protein, procalcitonin, D-dimer, lymphocyte count), lengths of stay in the ICU and mortality.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Mortality (dead/alive) at discharge from the ICU is defined as primary outcome

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to the intensive care units in South Tyrol due to COVID-19 associated respiratory failure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients admitted to the intensive care units in South Tyrol due to COVID-19 associated respiratory failure
Exclusion Criteria:
- SARS-CoV-2 patients admitted to the intensive care units in South Tyrol for other pathologies (i.e., not respiratory failure)
